title_en: Labor has called for intervention in Tata's plans to close the steel mill days after the election
summary_en:
Tata Steel plans to close two blast furnaces at a steel mill in Port Talbot following a strike by Unite members.
About 1,500 workers at a factory and another facility in Llanwern are planning to go on strike.
Tata's decision has angered politicians and trade unions who believe the company should wait until after the general election.
Labour politicians promise to allocate up to 3 billion pounds to support the industry's transition to low-carbon steel production.
The new electric arc furnace will be built by the end of 2027.
Tata Steel's decision to close the furnaces has sparked criticism and concerns about worker safety and the consequences for the industry.

title: –ö–∞–∫ –ü—Ä–æ—Ñ—Å–æ—é–∑—ã –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –ü–æ–º–æ—á—å –°–æ–∫—Ä–∞—Ç–∏—Ç—å –ì–µ–Ω–¥–µ—Ä–Ω—ã–π –†–∞–∑—Ä—ã–≤ –í –ó–∞—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω–æ–π –ü–ª–∞—Ç–µ
title_en: How Unions Can Help Reduce The Gender Wage Gap
summary_en:
The pandemic changed Janice Brown's attitude to work and prompted her to form a union at the museum.
Brown began talking to colleagues about forming a union in February 2020.
The pandemic has caused stronger feelings and a desire to form a trade union for economic reasons.
Most of Brown's colleagues supported the creation of a trade union, and the official election was won by a margin of 79%.
In May 2023, the first contract was signed, including an increase in the minimum wage and additional benefits.
The success of the Museum Workers' Association has inspired other non-profit organizations to raise the minimum wage.
The revival of the labor movement is taking place across the country due to the rising cost of living and rising corporate profits.

title: –ú–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç–µ—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–æ —Ç—Ä—É–¥–∞ –æ–±—ä—è–≤–∏–ª–æ, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –ø–ª–∞—Ç–∏—Ç—å –±–µ–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω—ã–º: –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ—Å–æ—é–∑ –ø–æ–¥–∞–ª –∂–∞–ª–æ–±—É
title_en: The Ministry of Labor announced that it would not pay the unemployed: the union filed a complaint
summary_en:
Employees of the Colombian Ministry of Labor have been on indefinite strike since May 31.
The strike lasts for 28 days without reaching a consensus between the parties.
The Acting Minister of Labor and the Deputy Prosecutor for Labor Issues said that the strikers would not be paid for non-working days.
The lack of an agreement is explained by economic and legal problems.
The strike led to the closure of offices and affected more than 152 municipal labor inspections.
Protestants seek to demand compliance with previous collective agreements.
The workers again asked to meet with the Minister to discuss their requests.

title: –†–∞–±–æ—á–∏–µ –ö–≤–µ–±–µ–∫–∞ –Ω–∞–∑–Ω–∞—á–∏–ª–∏ –¥–Ω–∏ –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∏ –Ω–∞ –∏—é–ª—å
title_en: Quebec workers set strike days for July
summary_en:
The Gazette has been an important part of the English-speaking community for over 245 years.
The newspaper provides reliable news and coverage of important issues.
The subscription includes unlimited online access to journalism, including columns by Allison Haines, Josh Freed and Bill Brownstein.
The opportunity to communicate with the community of commentators and learn from other readers on the forum.
Unlimited online access to the Montreal Gazette, the National Post, the New York Times crossword puzzle and 14 other news sites.
Support for local and future journalists.
The Montreal Gazette is an electronic newspaper for viewing on any device with the ability to share and comment.

title_en: Toronto Pearson Airport Inspectors Reject Tentative deal, Strike still Possible
summary_en:
Toronto Pearson Airport inspectors rejected a tentative agreement with the union.
A strike is still possible.
The union represents almost 3,000 employees involved in security checks.
GardaWorld, which operates at the airport, remains optimistic about the agreement.
The original deal called for a 24% salary increase over three years.
GardaWorld has won a tender for the provision of airport screening services in Canada.
Two contracts worth up to $2.66 billion were signed in April.
The strike could come at a crucial time for Toronto Pearson Airport due to the increase in passenger numbers during the summer holidays.
